Documentation

So how do you use it?

Grid System

Stylistic comes packed with a full 12 column grid system that can be modified to fit your needs, whatever they may be. Both standard CSS classes and mixins are included that will allow you to build your own system if you don't need the overhead that a pre-built grid provides.

Getting started

Getting up and going with our grid system is super easy. In fact, if you're already using Bootstrap you will have to do very little to get going. Some important things to note:

  • All rows need to be placed inside a container of some kind. The container you place it in is up to you and can either be a container, container-fluid, container-full, or a container that you create by using the make-container() Stylus mixin.
  • All columns must be placed inside of row elements. If you are having spacing issues make sure that you are following this rule.

Breakpoints

The breakpoints in Stylistic are completely customizable like everything else. The default breakpoints are as follows:

Extra SmallSmallMediumLargeExtra Large
Container widthNone576px720px940px1140px
Class prefix.col-xs.col-sm.col-md.col-lg.col-xl
# of columns12

Example - Container types

You can turn any container into a full-width container or a fluid container just by adding a class

<!-- This will be a full container with no gutters. Basically the same as having no container -->
<div class="container-full">
  <div class="row">
    ...
  </div>
</div>

<!-- This is the same as the above, but with gutters -->
<div class="container-fluid">
  <div class="row">
    ...
  </div>
</div>

Example - Responsiveness

Up till now our grid has only broken down at the media breakpoint. It's possible to define a different size for each breakpoint.

.col-xs-12 .col-md-8
.col-xs-6 .col-md-4
.col-xs-6 .col-md-4
.col-xs-6 .col-md-4
.col-xs-6 .col-md-4
.col-xs-6
<div class="row">
  <div class="col-xs-12 col-md-8"></div>
  <div class="col-xs-6 col-md-4"></div>
</div>
<div class="row">
  <div class="col-xs-6 col-md-4"></div>
  <div class="col-xs-6 col-md-4"></div>
  <div class="col-xs-6 col-md-4"></div>
</div>
<div class="row">
  <div class="col-xs-6"></div>
  <div class="col-xs-6"></div>
</div>

Example - Wrapping

When more columns are placed in a row than the grid system allows the extra columns will wrap

.col-xs-9
.col-xs-4
.col-xs-6
<div class="row">
  <div class="col-xs-9"></div>
  <div class="col-xs-4"></div>
  <div class="col-xs-6"></div>
</div>

Example - Column Resets

Occasionally you'll run into an issue where coluns don't match up because one is taller than the other. This can be fixed easily by using a clearfix combined with a responsive utility class.

.col-xs-6 .col-sm-3
View this on mobile to see what we're talking about
.col-xs-6 .col-sm-3
.col-xs-6 .col-sm-3
.col-xs-6 .col-sm-3
<div class="row">
  <div class="col-xs-6 col-sm-3">.col-sm-3<br />View this on mobile to see what we're talking about</div>
  <div class="col-xs-6 col-sm-3">.col-xs-6 .col-sm-3</div>
  <div class="clearfix visible-xs-block"></div>
  <div class="col-xs-6 col-sm-3">.col-xs-6 .col-sm-3</div>
  <div class="col-xs-6 col-sm-3">.col-xs-6 .col-sm-3</div>
</div>

Example - Column Offsets

You can move columns right by utilizing the col-offset property. This is exactly the same as the way Bootstrap does it.

.col-md-4
.col-md-4 .col-md-offset-4
.col-md-3 .col-md-offset-3
.col-md-3 .col-md-offset-3
.col-md-6 .col-md-offset-3
<div class="row">
  <div class="col-md-4">.col-md-4</div>
  <div class="col-md-4 col-md-offset-4"></div>
</div>
<div class="row">
  <div class="col-md-3 col-md-offset-3"></div>
  <div class="col-md-3 col-md-offset-3"></div>
</div>
  <div class="row">
  <div class="col-md-6 col-md-offset-3"></div>
</div>

Colors

Unlike with other frameworks, colors in Stylistic are completely customizable from the name to the color itself. That means you can have as many, or as few, colors as you want and when a color changes that change is seen in buttons, backgrounds, etc.

Things to note

Having this much control over colors is a big responsibility. To make sure nothing breaks:

  • Remember that some elements are already tied to a specific color. If you change the name of a color make sure to update your stylistic_overrides.styl file
  • Buttons, backgrounds, text-colors, and more will be automatically generated based on the colors you include. So the more colors the bigger your stylistic.css file will end up.

Palette

Teal
#009688
Orange
#ED8B00
Blue
#448AFF
Yellow
#d0c036
Red
#F44336
Gray
#9E9E9E

Icons

We decided to use the icon font IonIcons because it is beautiful and simple just like Stylistic. To view all of them go tohttp://ionicons.com

Examples

Buttons

Beautiful and fully customizable flat buttons

Regular Buttons

Teal ButtonOrange ButtonRed ButtonGray Button
<a href="#" class="button button-teal">Teal Button<a/>
<a href="#" class="button button-orange">Orange Button<a/>
<button class="button button-blue">Blue Button<a/>
<input class="button button-yellow" type="button" value="Yellow button" />
<a href="#" class="button button-red">Red Button<a/>
<a href="#" class="button button-gray">Gray Button<a/>
Known issues

#7 Right now when the .button class is applied to an input or a button element the element has a height of about 2 extra pixels

Dropdowns

Default

Gender
MaleFemaleSome other gender that we did not think of?
Gender
MaleFemale
Select one
The red oneThe green one
<div class="dropdown selection-dropdown m-r-1">
  <input type="hidden" name="gender">
  <i class="icon dropdown-caret dropdown-toggle"></i>
  <div class="dropdown-placeholder">Gender</div>
  <div class="dropdown-menu">
    <div class="dropdown-item" data-value="1">Male</div>
    <div class="dropdown-item" data-value="0">Female</div>
  </div>
</div>

<div class="dropdown selection-dropdown floating-dropdown">
  <input type="hidden" name="gender">
  <i class="icon dropdown-caret dropdown-toggle"></i>
  <div class="dropdown-placeholder">Gender</div>
  <div class="dropdown-menu">
    <div class="dropdown-item" data-value="1">Male</div>
    <div class="dropdown-item" data-value="0">Female</div>
  </div>
</div>

Messages

In the words of John Mayer, "Say what you need to say."

Default

Default message

This is a message!

Default dark message

This is a darker message!

<div class="message">
  <div class="header">Default message</div>
  <p>This is a message!</p>
</div>

<div class="message message-dark">
  <div class="header">Default dark message</div>
  <p>This is a darker message!</p>
</div>

Close Button

Close me!
This message has a close button
<div class="message">
  <div class="i ion ion-close close-btn"></div>
  <div class="header">Close me!</div>
  <div class="content">This message has a close button</div>
</div>

Syntax

Information message!
This is an info message
Danger message!
This is a danger message
Warning message!
This is a warning message
Success message!
This is a success message
<div class="message message-info">
  <div class="header">Information message!</div>
  <div class="content">This is an info message</div>
</div>

<div class="message message-danger">
  <div class="header">Danger message!</div>
  <div class="content">This is a danger message</div>
</div>

<div class="message message-warning">
  <div class="header">Warning message!</div>
  <div class="content">This is a warning message</div>
</div>

<div class="message message-success">
  <div class="header">Success message!</div>
  <div class="content">This is a success message</div>
</div>
